turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about V-Line.
turn.1: What happened in 2003 with the V-Line?
turn.2: Orange Line route's service hours shifted, running between 9:15 AM and 11:05 PM.
turn.4: The wait times at Dune Park station were shifted to allow the bus to connect to both eastbound and westbound trains (something that the previous version of the schedule rarely allowed).
turn.5: What else did you find interesting?
turn.6: Red Line's service hours were shifted and extended - it now started at 8:15 AM rather than 7:45 AM and ended at 11:55 PM rather than 10:35 PM.
turn.8: The decrease in the number of weekend trains allowed Valparaiso officials to increase Red Line's service frequencies during morning and evening hours.
turn.10: On December 3, 2009, V-Line General Manager Ryan Landers stated that system ridership was down for all lines.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: He also explained that while Red Line ridership was climbing, it was still significantly below the numbers for other routes, remaining in double digits.
